claim.claim-text:
A means for sustained release of optical clearing agent, characterized in that the means for sustained release of optical clearing agent comprises
a stick-shaped component including at least two supplying passages for supplying gas or liquid which are formed on the inside of the stick-shaped component and apertures of the respective supplying passages which are formed at positions along the circumference of the lateral surface in the vicinity of the top end of the stick-shaped component respectively,
at least two pouch-shaped elastic components placed at positions along the circumference of the lateral surface in the vicinity of the top end of the stick-shaped component respectively to cover the apertures of the supplying passages respectively, the pouched-shaped elastic components being capable of being controlled to inflate or deflate in accordance with an amount of an inflow of or an outflow of the gas or liquid,
an optical clearing agent holding component fixed on the surface of a first component of the pouch-shaped elastic components, the optical clearing agent holding component holding optical clearing agent and the optical clearing agent holding component being pressed to perform sustained release of the optical clearing agent to the outside, and
a body-fluid absorbing component fixed on the surface of a second component of the pouch-shaped elastic components, the body-fluid absorbing component absorbing body fluid which flows from a target object for sustained release of the optical clearing agent or the body-fluid absorbing component dehydrating the target object by osmotic pressure.

A means for sustained release of optical clearing agent according to claim 1, characterized in that a part in the vicinity of the top end of the stick-shaped component, which includes at least two pouch-shaped elastic components, is configured to be capable of rotating on an axis of the stick-shaped component.

A means for sustained release of optical clearing agent according to claim 1 or 2, characterized in that the optical clearing agent holding component includes innumerable protuberances which are formed on its surface.

A means for sustained release of optical clearing agent according to one of claims 1 to 3, characterized in that the means for sustained release of optical clearing agent comprises a penetration-rate adjusting means increasing a rate at which the optical clearing agent held by the optical clearing agent holding component penetrates into the target object.

A means for sustained release of optical clearing agent according to claim 4, characterized in that the penetration-rate adjusting means is a temperature adjusting apparatus heating gas or liquid which is supplied to the first pouch-shaped elastic component.

A means for sustained release of optical clearing agent according to claim 4 or 5, characterized in that the penetration-rate adjusting means is a penetration-rate accelerating agent which mixes with the optical clearing agent held by the optical clearing agent holding component.

A means for sustained release of optical clearing agent according to one of claims 1 to 6, characterized in that
the stick-shaped component includes a third supplying passage for supplying gas or liquid with an aperture of the third supplying passage formed at a position along the circumference of the lateral surface in the vicinity of the top end of the stick-shaped component, the third supplying passage being formed on the inside of the stick-shaped component, and
the means for sustained release of optical clearing agent comprises an optical clearing effect-cancelling agent holding component which is fixed on a surface of a third pouch-shaped elastic component, which holds liquid for returning the living tissue made transparent into its original state in which the living tissue is uncleared, and which is pressed to perform sustained release of the liquid for returning the living tissue made transparent into its original uncleared state of the living tissue to the outside, the third pouch-shaped elastic component being placed at a position along the circumference of the lateral surface in the vicinity of the top end of the stick-shaped component to cover the aperture of the third supplying passage while the position of the third pouch-shaped elastic component placed is being different from the positions of the first pouch-shaped elastic component and the second pouch-shaped elastic component placed respectively, and the third pouch-shaped elastic component being capable of being controlled to inflate and deflate in accordance with an amount of inflow of or outflow of the gas or liquid.

A means for sustained release of optical clearing agent according to one of claims 1 to 7, characterized in that the stick-shaped component further includes a supplying passage for supplying the optical clearing agent which communicates with the optical clearing agent holding component.
An endoscope comprising the means for sustained release of optical clearing agent according to one of claims 1 to 8.
An instrument for endoscopic surgery comprising the means for sustained release of optical clearing agent according to one of claims 1 to 8.
